Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Bayside Village Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would amend the New York State Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500 and to increase the maximum income eligibility thresholds of the Senior Citizen Homeowners Exemption (SCHE) program and the Disabled Homeowners Exemption (DHE) program to the same level.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Bayside Village Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amendment Proposed by Comm

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Bayside Village Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Bayside Village Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would amend the New York State Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500 and to increase the maximum income eligibility thresholds of the Senior Citizen Homeowners Exemption (SCHE) program and the Disabled Homeowners Exemption (DHE) program to the same level.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500.

Items.Title: The Following 2 items will be heard jointly with the Committee on Veterans

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend Sections 458 and 458-a of the New York Real Property Tax Law, in relation to extending partial property tax exemption provisions of such sections to the school tax portion of New York State property taxes for qualified veterans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Extending partial property tax exemption provisions of such sections to the school tax portion of NYS property taxes for qualified veterans.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Rebate of real property taxes on certain residential real property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending for one year the time to apply for certain benefits under the industrial and commercial incentive program in a city having a population of one million or more.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend Sections 458 and 458-a of the New York Real Property Tax Law, in relation to extending partial property tax exemption provisions of such sections to the school tax portion of New York State property taxes for qualified veterans.
